translated: The name related to a class is, for example, sentient being, form, feeling, great element, etc.üîΩThe name related to an individual is, for example, Buddhadatta, Gu·πáamitra, blue, yellow, etc.

original: yon tan las byung ba'i ming ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan las byung ba'i ming ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The name arising from a quality is, for example, wise, foolish, happy, unhappy, etc.

original: gzugs su rung bas gzugs dang / tshor bar byed pas @48b tshor ba dang / nyin mor byed pas nyi ma dang / sreg par byed pas me zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tha snyad las byung ba'i ming ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: grags pa'i ming ni yongs su rtog pa'i ming gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: rgyas pa'i ming ni yi ge mang po gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: de la tshig gi tshogs rnams ni ming dang yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa'o //

original: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug ste /

analyzed: de la bstan pa'i tshig ni 'di lta ste / dper na / dam pa rnams zhes bya ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: de la 'dun pa sngon du btang ba ni ming ngo //

original: ming zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /

analyzed: ming sna tshogs su legs par shes par byed pa'i phyir ming ngo //

analyzed: yang yid kyis mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir ming ngo //
translated: Moreover, name is that which causes the mental image to be known.

original: yang lkog tu gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir tshig gis brjod par byed pa'i phyir ming ngo //
analyzed: yang lkog tu gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir tshig gis brjod par byed pa'i phyir ming ngo //

original: ming gis mtha' blangs pa'i phyir tshig go //
analyzed: ming gis mtha' blangs pa'i phyir tshig go //
translated: Phrase is that which takes up the name.

original: ming dang tshig rjes su gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge'i tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: ming dang tshig rjes su gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge'i tshogs rnams so //
translated: Syllable is that which illuminates the name and the phrase.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dags dang tshig bla dags kyi lam zhes rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la tshig bla dags ni sde pa mtha' dag las byung ba dang rigs dang 'brel pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dags dang tshig bla dags kyi lam zhes rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la tshig bla dags ni sde pa mtha' dag las byung ba dang rigs dang 'brel pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The Blessed One has declared in detail the designation and the path of designation. In this regard, designation is the name that arises from the totality of the categories and is related to the class.

original: tshig bla dags kyi lam ni sde pa de dang rigs de dang 'dun pa ste de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig bla dags kyi lam ni sde pa de dang rigs de dang 'dun pa ste de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of designation is the totality of the categories, the class, and the intention, because it causes the designation to arise.

analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni bstan pa dang bshad pa de dang de dag re re la de bsgrub pa'i tshig gang yin pa'o //
translated: Etymological: the words that establish each of the teachings and explanations.

original: de'i rten de ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i rten de ni lam mo //
translated: The path is their basis.

original: 'dogs pa ni re re nas rnam par dbye ba 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa ni re re nas rnam par dbye ba 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Designation: the designation of the individual divisions.

original: de'i rten de ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i rten de ni lam mo //
translated: The path is their basis.

original: 'dun pa ni nges par bshad zin te 'dun pa gud med do //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni nges par bshad zin te 'dun pa gud med do //
translated: Aspiration has already been explained. There is no separate aspiration.

original: de'i tshig bla dags 'dogs par byed pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i tshig bla dags 'dogs par byed pa ni lam mo //
translated: The designation of its name is the path.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The basis of those collections of names, etc., is in brief of six kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: chos dang / don dang / gang zag dang / dus dang / grangs dang skabs so //
analyzed: chos dang / don dang / gang zag dang / dus dang / grangs dang skabs so //
translated: the teaching, the meaning, the person, time, number, and occasion.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Their divisions are as follows:

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as taught in the stage of learning.

original: de la ngag ni mdor bsdu na grong khyer ba dang snyan cing 'jebs pa la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ngag ni mdor bsdu na grong khyer ba dang snyan cing 'jebs pa la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Speech should be understood as being endowed with eight qualities, such as being urban and pleasant.

original: de tshig dang yi ge 'byor pa zhes bya ba nas 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de tshig dang yi ge 'byor pa zhes bya ba nas 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma, from the arrangement of words and syllables up to the collection of the limbs of vigor.

original: de la ngag grong khyer pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ngag grong khyer pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, urban speech is so called because it is governed by the city of nirvana.

analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni sgra mnyen zhing snyan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant speech is so called because it is gentle and pleasing to the ear.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni tshig dang @49b yi ge legs par 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni tshig dang @49b yi ge legs par 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni chos dang don dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni chos dang don dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Worthy of hearing speech is so called because it is endowed with Dharma and meaning.

original: mi rten pa ni dad pa'i bya ba la mi rten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rten pa ni dad pa'i bya ba la mi rten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Independent speech is so called because it is not dependent on the activity of faith.

original: mi mthun pa med pa ni ran par smra ba nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa ni ran par smra ba nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Unopposed speech is so called because it is spoken in moderation.

original: mi gtugs pa ni rgya che zhing mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtugs pa ni rgya che zhing mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The latter is not a fault, because it is extensive and skillful.

original: ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi yon tan yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi yon tan yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /

original: dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa gcig gis so //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa gcig gis so //
translated: 1) mastery, by one kind;

original: ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis kyis so //

analyzed: 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba la 'grus skyong zhes bya ba ni gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa'o //

analyzed: bsdus pa'i don dang / rgyas pa'i don to //

original: rgyas par byas nas bcu bdun te /
analyzed: rgyas par byas nas bcu bdun te /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshogs lnga dang ldan pa la sogs pa phung po med pa'i sa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag go //
translated: from the stage of the five collections of consciousness up to the stage of the ultimate reality of the absence of the subject-object aspect.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi don ni rnam par lnga blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi don ni rnam par lnga blta bar bya ste /

translated: the characteristic of intrinsic nature, the characteristic of general nature, the characteristic of conventional nature, the characteristic of causal nature, and the characteristic of resultant nature.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /

translated: The same should be understood for the absence of characteristics, as previously taught in the stage of the wisdom arisen from meditation.üîΩHere, the meaning of mental attention is sevenfold mental attention:

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: mental attention to the characteristics, mental attention to the investigation of principles, mental attention to the investigation of meanings, mental attention to the investigation of differences, mental attention to the investigation of composites, mental attention to the investigation of time, and mental attention to the investigation of the truths.üîΩMental attention to the characteristics is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the five characteristics of the imagined, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Mental attention to the investigation of principles is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the principles of the aggregates, etc.üîΩMental attention to the investigation of meanings is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the meanings of impermanence, etc.üîΩMental attention to the investigation of differences is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the differences of the aggregates, etc.üîΩMental attention to the investigation of composites is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the composites of the aggregates, etc.üîΩMental attention to the investigation of time is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the three times.üîΩMental attention to the investigation of the truths is the mental attention of bodhisattvas to the investigation of the four noble truths.

original: shes pa bcu ni /
analyzed: shes pa bcu ni /
translated: The ten knowledges are:

original: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the teaching, the knowledge of subsequent realization, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of convention,

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of exhaustion, and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di lta ste ;
translated: Their divisions are as follows:

original: / nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As taught in the ≈örƒÅvaka Levels.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te /
translated: The six collections of consciousness are from eye consciousness to mind consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa dang / yid kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa dang / yid kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The five collections of consciousness and the mental consciousness, as previously explained in the section on the levels.

original: yongs su shes pa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine types of complete knowledge:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa na yongs su shes pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa na yongs su shes pa gcig go //
translated: When the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the desire realm are abandoned, there is one complete knowledge.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second complete knowledge is the abandonment of the suffering and origin that are associated with the form and formless realms and that are to be abandoned by seeing.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third complete knowledge is the abandonment of the cessation that is associated with the desire realm and that is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the cessation that is associated with the form and formless realms and that is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the path that is associated with the desire realm and that is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the path that is associated with the form and formless realms and that is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun tu sbyor ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun tu sbyor ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh complete knowledge is the abandonment of the fetters that are associated with the lower realms.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags mdzad pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags mdzad pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of attachment to the form realm is the eighth complete knowledge.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zad pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zad pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of attachment to the formless realm is the ninth complete knowledge.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Their classification is as follows:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: just as they are taught in the section on meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The three doors of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di @51a * //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang 'di @51a * //
translated: Their classification is as follows:

original: lta ste / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ste / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: just as they are taught in the section on meditative equipoise.üîΩBy how many types of attention and cognition are they to be known?üîΩBy how many types of consciousness are they to be cognized?

original: de la yid la byed pa du dag gis yid la bya ba dang shes pa dag gis shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa du dag gis rnam par shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba du dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa du dag gis yid la bya ba dang shes pa dag gis shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa du dag gis rnam par shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba du dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
translated: By how many types of complete knowledge are they to be completely known?

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo du dag gis rnam par thar par bya ba de ltar chos yongs su brtag pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo du dag gis rnam par thar par bya ba de ltar chos yongs su brtag pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should begin the investigation of the Dharma in this way, by means of the doors of liberation.

original: de la dbang du bya ba'i don ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbang du bya ba'i don ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of mastery is, in brief, threefold:

original: dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / dus kyi dbang du bya ba dang / gang zag gi dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / dus kyi dbang du bya ba dang / gang zag gi dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: mastery over things, mastery over time, and mastery over persons.

original: de la dngos po'i dbang du bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i dbang du bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mastery over things is also threefold:

original: dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / de'i thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / de'i thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i dbang du bya ba dang / gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: mastery over the thing itself, mastery over the means of attaining it, and mastery over the means of benefiting others.

original: de la dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mastery over the thing itself is sixfold:

original: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / nyams pa dang / khyad par dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / nyams pa dang / khyad par dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: mastery over good destinies, mastery over bad destinies, mastery over regression, mastery over distinction, mastery over sa·πÉsƒÅra, and mastery over nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de'i thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the twelve practices:

original: spyod pa bcu gnyis po 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa dang / dge ba'i spyod pa dang / mi dge ba'i spyod pa dang / drag po'i spyod pa dang / drag po ma yin pa'i spyod pa dang / nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: spyod pa bcu gnyis po 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa dang / dge ba'i spyod pa dang / mi dge ba'i spyod pa dang / drag po'i spyod pa dang / drag po ma yin pa'i spyod pa dang / nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang /
translated: the practice of desire, the practice of renunciation, the practice of virtue, the practice of nonvirtue, the practice of violence, the practice of nonviolence, the practice of regression,

original: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa dang / bdag gi don gyi spyod pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa dang / bdag gi don gyi spyod pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa'o //
translated: the practice of distinction, the practice of defilement, the practice of purification, the practice of ones own aim, and the practice of others aim.

original: gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po'i dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The things that are the bases of others compassion are of five kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the five kinds of suffering:

original: 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs pa bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs pa bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: 1) turning away from desire, 2) teaching correctly, 3) engaging in correct practice, 4) praising and extolling correct practice, and 5) gladdening.

original: de la bde 'gro ni mi rnams dang lha rnams so //
analyzed: de la bde 'gro ni mi rnams dang lha rnams so //
translated: Here, good destiny refers to humans and gods.

original: ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnams so //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnams so //
translated: Bad destiny refers to the lower realms.

original: de la nyams pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nyams pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, decline is of two kinds:

original: gzhan la brten pa dang / gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa dang / gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: that which is dependent on others and that which is not dependent on others.

original: de la dang po ni bdag nyid kyi tshe nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni bdag nyid kyi tshe nyams pa'o //
translated: The first is the decline of one's own life.

original: tshe ji lta ba bzhin du kha dog dang / stobs dang / @51b longs spyod dang / snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / spobs pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe ji lta ba bzhin du kha dog dang / stobs dang / @51b longs spyod dang / snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / spobs pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with life, one should understand it similarly with regard to complexion, strength, wealth, fame, happiness, eloquence, and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni dge ba nyams pa dang dbang phyug gi bdag po nyams pa dang dbang chung bar grags pa nyid dang / tshig mi btsun pa nyid dang / shes rab 'chal ba nyid dang / gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rgya chen po ma yin pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge ba nyams pa dang dbang phyug gi bdag po nyams pa dang dbang chung bar grags pa nyid dang / tshig mi btsun pa nyid dang / shes rab 'chal ba nyid dang / gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rgya chen po ma yin pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: The second is the degeneration of virtue, the degeneration of the sovereignty of a lord, the reputation of being weak, the use of vulgar language, the use of foolish language, the acquisition of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible sensations that are not excellent,

original: de dag longs spyod rgya chen po dag la sems mi 'jug pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag longs spyod rgya chen po dag la sems mi 'jug pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: the mind not engaging in the enjoyment of those, and the mind not engaging in the enjoyment of those.

original: khyad par ni de las bzlog pa las ci rigs pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni de las bzlog pa las ci rigs pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinctive qualities should be understood as the opposite of those, as appropriate.

original: de la 'khor ba ni bde 'gro dang nyams pa dang / khyad par de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ni bde 'gro dang nyams pa dang / khyad par de dag nyid yin no //
translated: In this context, samsara is the happy realms, degeneration, and distinctive qualities.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Nirvana is the realm of nirvana without remainder, from the nirvana with remainder.

original: de la 'dod pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this context, the conduct of desire is as follows:

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu po dag ste bar ma las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu po dag ste bar ma las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The ten enjoyments are as described in the sutra on the middle length teachings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ni longs spyod de dag nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par shes nas rab tu byung zhing tshul khrims dang dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ni longs spyod de dag nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par shes nas rab tu byung zhing tshul khrims dang dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conduct of renunciation is the enjoyment of those enjoyments, when one has gone forth into the houseless state, having understood them to be impermanent, etc., and it is the restraint of morality and the sense-faculties, etc.

original: dge ba'i spyod pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa dag gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa dag gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conduct of virtue is the practice of the virtue that is related to the outflows, through generosity, morality, and meditation.

original: mi dge ba'i spyod pa ni nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa'o //üîΩdrag po'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i spyod pa ni nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa'o // drag po'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conduct of non-virtue is the practice of the three kinds of bad conduct.

original: gcer bu dang gos med pa la sogs pa dag go //üîΩdrag po ma yin pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcer bu dang gos med pa la sogs pa dag go // drag po ma yin pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conduct of violence is, for example, the nakedness, the going without clothes, etc.

original: chos kyis thob pa'i bde ba yongs su mi spong zhing /
analyzed: chos kyis thob pa'i bde ba yongs su mi spong zhing /
translated: The conduct that is not violent is, for example, the non-abandonment of the happiness that is obtained through Dharma.

original: mtha' gnyis po 'dod pa'i bsod nams kyi rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' dang bdag nyid ngal ba'i rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la brten te chos kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol zhing longs spyod pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩnyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩtshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi bar du gcod pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis po 'dod pa'i bsod nams kyi rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' dang bdag nyid ngal ba'i rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la brten te chos kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol zhing longs spyod pa gang yin pa'o // nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste / tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi bar du gcod pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of decline is the practice of obstacles to the excellences of life, etc.

original: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩne tso'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pa ni 'di lta ste / ne tso'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The practice of distinction is the opposite of that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩlas kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'jug pa'i kun nas @52a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'jug pa'i kun nas @52a * //
translated: The practice of defilement is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the defilement of action, the defilement of the passions, and the defilement of rebirth.üîΩThe practice of purification is the opposite of that.

original: de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: The root of these should be known as ninefold.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
translated: The root of the defilement of action is the three: passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni phyin ci log bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni phyin ci log bzhi'o //
translated: The root of the defilement of defilement is the four inversions.

original: 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni ma rig pa dang srid pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ni ma rig pa dang srid pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: The root of the defilement of engagement is ignorance and craving for existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po dag gis skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po dag gis skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because the defilement of action arises from the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni phyin ci log bzhis skye bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes na rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur la khyim pa gnas pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni srid pa'i sred pa'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyurüîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni phyin ci log bzhis skye bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes na rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur la khyim pa gnas pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni srid pa'i sred pa'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Afflictive emotion is generated by the four errors, and when afflictive emotion is generated, the afflictive emotions of the ordained are generated by way of nescience, and the afflictive emotions of the lay who are householders are generated by way of craving for existence.

original: rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na bslab pa gsum dang / sa lnga ste tshogs kyi sa nas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na bslab pa gsum dang / sa lnga ste tshogs kyi sa nas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The conduct of purification is, in brief, the three educations and the five stages, as before, from the stage of equipment up to the stage of going forth.

original: bslab pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: And the basic foundation of those educations, etc., should be known as ninefold:

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyis ni chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyis ni chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams so //
translated: The three educations are the three foundations of the training. The three foundations of the training are the three roots of virtue, i.e., nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: tshogs kyi sa dang sbyor ba'i sa ni phyin ci ma log pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sa dang sbyor ba'i sa ni phyin ci ma log pa bzhi'o //
translated: The stage of accumulation and the stage of preparation are the four correct exertions.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'o //üîΩde la bdag gi don gyi spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'o // de la bdag gi don gyi spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The training in higher wisdom, the stage of seeing, the stage of meditative development, and the stage that leads to the final goal are the knowledge and the liberation.

original: bdag la phan pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The practice for one's own benefit is that which accomplishes one's own aim.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi'o ;
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi'o ;
translated: that of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: /'di ltar de dag ni lan 'ga' gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la yang byed mod kyi gzhan gyi don kho na la 'jug pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag gi don gyi spyod pa kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: /'di ltar de dag ni lan 'ga' gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la yang byed mod kyi gzhan gyi don kho na la 'jug pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag gi don gyi spyod pa kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Although they sometimes accomplish the aims of others, they do not engage in the aims of others alone; therefore, it is called the practice for one's own benefit.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa ni skye bo mang po la bde ba la sogs pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa ni skye bo mang po la bde ba la sogs pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The practice for the benefit of others is that which accomplishes the aims of others, for the sake of the happiness of many people, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of the bodhisattvas and of the Tathagatas.

original: de la 'dun pa zlog pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyi spyod pa drug gi mi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / nyes dmigs yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa zlog pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyi spyod pa drug gi mi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / nyes dmigs yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the demonstration is the statement of the dispraise of the six kinds of dark actions and the teaching of their danger.

original: de la yang dag par ston pa ni dkar po'i spyod pa rnams yang dag par @52b 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir rigs pa bzhi yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par ston pa ni dkar po'i spyod pa rnams yang dag par @52b 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir rigs pa bzhi yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the teaching is the teaching of the four reasons for the purpose of causing the taking up of the bright actions.

original: de la yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa ni yang dag par bstan cing mos par gyur pa rnams bslab pa'i gzhi gzung ba bsgrub pa la 'di lta ste /üîΩgdon mi za bar byas nas bdag gis da ci zhig bgyi zhes zer ba la khyod kyis 'di lta 'di ltar sgrubs shig ces yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa ni yang dag par bstan cing mos par gyur pa rnams bslab pa'i gzhi gzung ba bsgrub pa la 'di lta ste /üîΩgdon mi za bar byas nas bdag gis da ci zhig bgyi zhes zer ba la khyod kyis 'di lta 'di ltar sgrubs shig ces yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the taking up is the establishment of the bodhisattva in the precepts after he has been taught and has become convinced.üîΩHere, the correct application is the correct application of the bodhisattva who has been established in the precepts, who is engaged in the practice of the application, and who is told, ‚ÄúYou must do this and that without fail.‚Äù

original: de la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni kun shes pa'am bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni kun shes pa'am bsgrub pa'am /
translated: Encouragement is the act of encouraging someone who is discouraged about understanding, accomplishing, or attaining something, by telling him or her You are able to do it!

original: thob par bya ba la sems zhum pa'i tshe na skal ba dang ldan zhing mthu yod pas sems yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba la sems zhum pa'i tshe na skal ba dang ldan zhing mthu yod pas sems yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Encouragement is the act of encouraging someone who is discouraged about understanding, accomplishing, or attaining something, by telling him or her You are able to do it!

original: de la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la yang dag pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la yang dag pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Praise is the act of praising someone who is practicing a Dharma that is similar to the Dharma that you teach, by saying, You are doing well!üîΩ There are four types of ways of teaching:

original: 'dun pa bzlog par byed pa yin la yang dag par ston par byed pa ma yin pa yang yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa bzlog par byed pa yin la yang dag par ston par byed pa ma yin pa yang yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: 1. There are ways of teaching that are a reversal of desire but not a form of instruction.

original: che ge mo zhig 'di skad zer gyis 'di ma byed cig ces gzhan gyi tshig gis 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'am /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig 'di skad zer gyis 'di ma byed cig ces gzhan gyi tshig gis 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'am /
translated: For example, you might tell someone, ‚ÄúSo-and-so says that you should not do this,‚Äù in order to reverse the person‚Äôs desire to do something.

original: gal te byed na 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes bsdigs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te byed na 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes bsdigs par byed pa'am /
translated: Or you might threaten someone by saying, ‚ÄúIf you do this, then this and that will happen to you.‚Äù

original: kho bo la byams pa'i phyir ma byed cig ces gsol ba 'debs par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kho bo la byams pa'i phyir ma byed cig ces gsol ba 'debs par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: Or you might make a request by saying, ‚ÄúDo not do this out of affection for me.‚Äù

original: yang dag par ston pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par ston pa yin la /
translated: There is one who teaches correctly

original: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but does not turn away from desire.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: For example,

original: yon tan dang skyon tha mal pa la yang dag par ston par byed la de skyon las bzlog tu mi rung ba lta bu'o //

original: yang dag par ston par byed 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is one who teaches correctly and turns away from desire,üîΩfor example,

original: skyon la gnas pa la yang dag par bstan nas 'dun pa zlog par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyon la gnas pa la yang dag par bstan nas 'dun pa zlog par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: one teaches correctly to one who abides in faults and turns away from desire.üîΩThere is one who engages in correct practice and encourages correctly,üîΩfor example,

original: de la yang dag par 'dzin du yang 'jug la yang dag par gzengs stod par byed pa ni dang po nyid du bslab pa yang dag par ma blangs pa dang / gong ma'i khyad par la zhum pa na khyad par rtsom pa la'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'dzin du yang 'jug la yang dag par gzengs stod par byed pa ni dang po nyid du bslab pa yang dag par ma blangs pa dang / gong ma'i khyad par la zhum pa na khyad par rtsom pa la'o //
translated: one who has not taken up the training from the beginning and one who is discouraged about the special higher qualities.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba la phan yon lnga yod de /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba la phan yon lnga yod de /
translated: There are five benefits to correct joy.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba na rang gi rtogs pa la nges par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan dag de'i yon tan rtogs par bya ba la dga' ba skye ba dang / zhe 'gras pa rnams de la dad par 'gyur ba dang / ma dad pa rnams tha mal par gnas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba na rang gi rtogs pa la nges par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan dag de'i yon tan rtogs par bya ba la dga' ba skye ba dang / zhe 'gras pa rnams de la dad par 'gyur ba dang / ma dad pa rnams tha mal par gnas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Moreover, when one rejoices in the truth, one becomes certain in one‚Äôs own understanding, others generate the joy of understanding its virtues, those who are hostile become faithful, those who are not faithful remain neutral,

original: dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩyang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i gang @53a * //
analyzed: dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o // yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i gang @53a * //
translated: and those who are faithful increase in faith.

original: zag ni yid du 'ong ba'i lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byed cing sogs te /
analyzed: zag ni yid du 'ong ba'i lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byed cing sogs te /
translated: The person who rejoices in the truth creates the karma to be reborn in a heavenly realm of happiness and so on.

original: de ni gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der yid du 'ong ba 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur gyi /üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der yid du 'ong ba 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur gyi / yid du mi 'ong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Wherever he is reborn, he obtains only what is pleasant and never what is unpleasant.

original: de la 'dod pa'i spyod pas ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i spyod pas ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also a person who goes to a happy migratory state through the practice of desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: phyi ma'i 'dod pa'i rgyur 'di la dge ba byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i 'dod pa'i rgyur 'di la dge ba byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: one who does good in this life for the sake of future desires.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There are also those who go to bad destinies.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chos ma yin pas 'dod pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas 'dod pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: those who obtain their desires through unrighteous means.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ni nyams par byas pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur la phun sum tshogs par byas pas ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ni nyams par byas pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur la phun sum tshogs par byas pas ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By destroying the practice of renunciation, one goes to bad destinies. By perfecting it, one goes to good destinies and accumulates the requisites for nirvana.

original: dge ba'i spyod pas kyang bde 'gror 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pas kyang bde 'gror 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the practice of virtue, one goes to good destinies and accumulates the requisites for nirvana.

original: mi dge ba'i spyod pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i spyod pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the practice of non-virtue, one goes to bad destinies.

original: drag po'i spyod pas kyang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: drag po'i spyod pas kyang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the practice of violence, one goes to bad destinies.

original: log par lta ba la brten pas bdag nyid kun tu gdung ba byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba la brten pas bdag nyid kun tu gdung ba byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because one torments oneself by relying on wrong views.

original: drag po ma yin pa'i spyod pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drag po ma yin pa'i spyod pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the practice of non-violence, one accumulates the requisites for nirvana.

original: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pas ni ci rigs par nyams pa dang khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i spyod pas ni ci rigs par nyams pa dang khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ni 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ni 'khor bar 'gyur ro //

original: rnam par byang ba'i spyod pas ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i spyod pas ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The purified practice leads to nirvana.

original: bdag gi don gyi spyod pas ni bdag nyid bder 'gror 'gro ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don gyi spyod pas ni bdag nyid bder 'gror 'gro ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The practice for one's own benefit leads to one's own going to good rebirths, to distinction, and to nirvana.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pas ni bdag dang gzhan dag bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pas ni bdag dang gzhan dag bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: de dag ni dngos po gsum du 'gyur te //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po gsum du 'gyur te //
translated: These practices are included in three things:

original: dngos gzhi'i dngos po ni bde 'gro la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dngos po ni bde 'gro la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du rnam pa drug go //
translated: The basic thing is the six aspects of the basic thing, from good rebirth up to nirvana.

original: de 'thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po ni spyod pa bcu gnyis so //üîΩgzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po ni gang gis gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba na dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du byas nas spyod pa bcu gnyis po de dag la ci rigs par 'dun pa zlog par byed pa nas yang dag par rab tu
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po ni spyod pa bcu gnyis so // gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba'i dngos po ni gang gis gzhan gyis rjes su snying brtse ba na dngos gzhi'i dngos po'i dbang du byas nas spyod pa bcu gnyis po de dag la ci rigs par 'dun pa zlog par byed pa nas yang dag par rab tu
translated: The thing that is the means of attaining it is the twelve practices.üîΩThe thing that is the object of another's compassion is the twelve practices, from the point of view of the main thing, in regard to which one should be turned away from desire, etc.,

original: dga' @53b bar byed pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: dga' @53b bar byed pa'i bar ro //
translated: and should be caused to rejoice, when one is being comforted by another.

original: de la dus kyi dbang du bya ba ni mdor bsdu na gtam gyi dngos po gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dus kyi dbang du bya ba ni mdor bsdu na gtam gyi dngos po gsum ste /

analyzed: 'das pa'i gtam gyi dngos po dang ma 'ongs pa'i gtam gyi dngos po dang / da ltar byung ba'i gtam gyi dngos po mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin no //
translated: as they are stated in the scriptures: the topic of conversation about the past, the topic of conversation about the future, and the topic of conversation about the present.

original: de gang zag gi dbang du bya ba ni dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag nyi shu rtsa bdun po dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gang zag gi dbang du bya ba ni dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag nyi shu rtsa bdun po dag yin par rig par bya'o //

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i dngos po dang / dus dang / gang zag de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gtam 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dbang du bya ba zhes bya'o //

translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas have spoken in terms of things, times, and persons as they have been taught. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúthe objects of mastery.‚Äù

original: de la phan yon gyi don mdor bsdu na chos sam gang zag bsngags pa'i don bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan yon gyi don mdor bsdu na chos sam gang zag bsngags pa'i don bstod pa'o //

original: de la nyes dmigs kyi don ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos sam gang zag mi bsngags pa'i don smad pa'o //

analyzed: de la gnyen po'i don ni rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa thams cad de /
translated: Among them, the meaning of the antidote is all the conduct of purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na / 'dod chags ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: dper na / 'dod chags ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
translated: greed is a counteragent,

original: de'i gnyen po ni mi sdug pa yin pa dang / zhe sdang ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de'i gnyen po ni byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mi sdug pa yin pa dang / zhe sdang ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de'i gnyen po ni byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: The concise meaning is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rigs dang 'brel ba'i chos bstan pa las so //
analyzed: rigs dang 'brel ba'i chos bstan pa las so //

original: de la rgyas pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rgyas pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: so so dang 'brel ba'i chos bstan pa las so //
analyzed: so so dang 'brel ba'i chos bstan pa las so //

analyzed: don ma rtogs pa ni ma rtogs pas tshig 'bru 'di'i don ci yin zhes rgol lo //
translated: The reply of non-understanding is when one replies, ‚ÄúI do not understand the meaning of this expression.‚Äù

original: tshig 'gal bas ni 'di lta ste bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar ni gzhan du gsungs la 'dir ni gzhan du gsungs so zhes bya ba lta bus so //
analyzed: tshig 'gal bas ni 'di lta ste bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar ni gzhan du gsungs la 'dir ni gzhan du gsungs so zhes bya ba lta bus so //
translated: The reply of contradiction is when one replies, ‚ÄúThe Blessed One has said it in one place, but in another place, he has said the opposite.‚Äù

original: rigs pa dang 'gal bas ni gang la rigs pa bzhi dang 'gal ba kun du snang bas so //üîΩcha du ma kun du snang bas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal bas ni gang la rigs pa bzhi dang 'gal ba kun du snang bas so //üîΩcha du ma kun du snang bas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reply of contradiction with reason is when one replies, ‚ÄúIt is contradicted by the four kinds of reasonings.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply of the appearance of many parts is when one replies, ‚ÄúIt is contradicted by the appearance of many parts.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der rnam grangs du mas don de nyid yongs su bstan pa lta bus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der rnam grangs du mas don de nyid yongs su bstan pa lta bus so //
translated: The Lord has taught that very meaning in many ways in various places.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the case of the very obscure, it is like this:

original: nang gi bdag gang yin pa de ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang yang dag pa de kho na bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag gang yin pa de ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang yang dag pa de kho na bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIs there any such thing as the inner self that is permanent, stable, and enduring, and that remains just as it is?‚Äù

original: de dag gi lan yang rnam pa lngar go rims bzhin du @56a * //
analyzed: de dag gi lan yang rnam pa lngar go rims bzhin du @56a * //
translated: The answers to those are to be understood in five ways, respectively.

original: rig par bya ste ma rtogs pa la ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig par bya ste ma rtogs pa la ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: For the non-realized, it is to be realized.

original: tshig 'gal ba la ni dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pas rjes su mthun par bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'gal ba la ni dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pas rjes su mthun par bya ba'o //
translated: For the contradictory, it is to be made consistent through teaching the intention.

original: tshig 'gal ba la dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pas rjes su mthun par bya ba ji lta bar cha du mar snang ba dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshig 'gal ba la dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pas rjes su mthun par bya ba ji lta bar cha du mar snang ba dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as it is to be made consistent through teaching the intention in the case of the contradictory, so it is also for the manifold appearance and the very obscure.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni nag po bstan pa dang rigs pa bzhi bstan pa dang che ge zhig gi 'bras bu ni 'di yin no zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa bstan pas lan gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni nag po bstan pa dang rigs pa bzhi bstan pa dang che ge zhig gi 'bras bu ni 'di yin no zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa bstan pas lan gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: The answer by contradiction is to be given by teaching the black side and the four reasons, and by teaching the connection between cause and effect, saying, ‚ÄúSuch and such is the result.‚Äù

original: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni tshul bzhin du yongs su 'dri ba la chos kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni tshul bzhin du yongs su 'dri ba la chos kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the answer by way of a single statement is to be given in order to properly establish the characteristics of the Dharma for one who asks in a proper way.

original: rnam par phye ste lan gdab pa ni tshul dang tshul bzhin ma yin par yongs su 'dri ba rnams la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste lan gdab pa ni tshul dang tshul bzhin ma yin par yongs su 'dri ba rnams la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer by way of analysis is to be given in order to understand the distinguishing characteristics for one who asks in a proper and improper way.

original: yongs su dris te lan gdab pa ni klan ka tshol ba la phyogs khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dris te lan gdab pa ni klan ka tshol ba la phyogs khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer by way of counter-question is to be given in order to accept a position for one who seeks to find fault.

original: gzhag par lan gdab pa ni med pa'i phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu bzhis lan gdab par bya ba gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gzhag par lan gdab pa ni med pa'i phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu bzhis lan gdab par bya ba gzhag pa ste /
translated: The answer by setting aside is to be given by setting aside the answer for four reasons, such as because of non-existence and because of profundity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i sar de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod ces bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis kyang lan gdab par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i sar de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod ces bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis kyang lan gdab par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: The answer should not be given in terms of the conventional truth, as was previously explained, ‚ÄúThe Tathagata exists after death,‚Äù etc.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul gyis kyang rigs pa ma yin pas kyang de'i phyir de ni gzhag par bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul gyis kyang rigs pa ma yin pas kyang de'i phyir de ni gzhag par bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And it should not be given in terms of the ultimate truth, either. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúset aside.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa med pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa med pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po ma yin no //
translated: In that regard, it is not an entity ultimately, because the Tathagata does not exist.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang de'i 'bras bu spangs pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir yang kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod ces bya ba la sogs par drang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang de'i 'bras bu spangs pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir yang kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod ces bya ba la sogs par drang bar mi nus so //
translated: And it cannot be interpreted as ‚ÄúThe Tathagata exists after death,‚Äù etc., in terms of the conventional, because that would contradict what is possible and impossible and because the result of that, the abandonment, would not be accomplished.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of connections:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'o //
translated: The connection of the complete, the connection of the explanation, and the connection of the proof.

original: rnam pa de gsum gyi mtshams sbyar ba'i dpe ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni shin tu gzhon nu dang mchog tu shin tu gzhon nu dang / rab tu shin tu gzhon nur rab tu byung ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa des ni shin tu gzhon nur yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum gyi mtshams sbyar ba'i dpe ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni shin tu gzhon nu dang mchog tu shin tu gzhon nu dang / rab tu shin tu gzhon nur rab tu byung ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa des ni shin tu gzhon nur yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The example of the three kinds of connections is the statement of the Lord: ‚ÄúI went forth when I was a youth, a supreme youth, a very young youth.‚Äù By this he shows that he was a youth in the complete sense.

original: yab zas @56b gtsang gis nga'i gnas khang bzangs rtsig tu bcug par gyur to zhes rgya char gsungs pa des ni shin tu gzhon nur de nyid rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yab zas @56b gtsang gis nga'i gnas khang bzangs rtsig tu bcug par gyur to zhes rgya char gsungs pa des ni shin tu gzhon nur de nyid rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The statement: ‚ÄúMy father Suddhodana had a palace built for me,‚Äù shows that he was a youth in the sense of the explanation.

original: ci'i phyir shin tu gzhon nur rab tu byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shin tu gzhon nur rab tu byung zhe na /
translated: Why did he go forth when he was a youth?

original: na ba'i chos nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: na ba'i chos nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Because he saw the nature of old age, etc. This is the connection of the proof.

original: gang du bsdus te mdor bstan pa tsam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang du bsdus te mdor bstan pa tsam 'di lta ste /
translated: The brief indication of the summary is as follows:

original: tshor ba gsum po bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum po bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba kho na yin te /
translated: The three feelings are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de ni tshor ba de nyid tshig lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba de nyid tshig lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The complete indication is only the connection, because that is the complete statement of the feeling by the remaining words.

original: tshor ba ji lta bar bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra ste tshig dang po dang rjes su mthun par tshig phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ji lta bar bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra ste tshig dang po dang rjes su mthun par tshig phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four noble truths and so on are also like that, because the order of explanation is in accordance with the first word and the subsequent words.

original: de la bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa'i mtshams sbyar ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The connection of proof is twofold:

original: lan 'ga' ni tshig snga ma tshig phyi ma'i bsgrub pa yin la lan 'ga' ni tshig phyi ma tshig snga ma'i bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni tshig snga ma tshig phyi ma'i bsgrub pa yin la lan 'ga' ni tshig phyi ma tshig snga ma'i bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: sometimes the former word is the proof of the latter word, and sometimes the latter word is the proof of the former word.

original: rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The introduction to the explanation should be understood in the same way.

original: de la chos bcu dang ldan pa'i chos smra ba ni rnam par thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing chos dang don la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chos bcu dang ldan pa'i chos smra ba ni rnam par thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing chos dang don la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the Dharma teacher who has ten qualities is complete in every way and is skilled in the Dharma and its meaning.

original: de la chos ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de la chos ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: Therein, the Dharma is sixfold.

original: don ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The meaning is tenfold.

original: gtam la rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: gtam la rgya che ba yin te /
translated: The discourse is extensive.

original: ji lta zhe na mang du thos pa dang thos pa 'dzin pa dang thos pa bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na mang du thos pa dang thos pa 'dzin pa dang thos pa bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because of much learning, retention of what is learned, and accumulation of what is learned.

original: 'khor gyi nang du mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: He is fearless in the midst of the assembly.

original: rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams la chos ston pa na zhum pa med cing de'i rgyu las byung ba'i skad 'dar ba dang mchan khung rdul ba dang / dran pas brjed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams la chos ston pa na zhum pa med cing de'i rgyu las byung ba'i skad 'dar ba dang mchan khung rdul ba dang / dran pas brjed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When teaching the Dharma to assemblies of nobles and so forth, he is not timid, and his voice does not tremble, his armpits do not sweat, and he does not forget due to the cause of that.

original: tshig dge zhing tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig dge zhing tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is virtuous in speech and has the activity of speech.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig dang ldan zhing 'khor la tshig dang yi ge 'byor pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa rgyas pas chos ston par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig dang ldan zhing 'khor la tshig dang yi ge 'byor pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa rgyas pas chos ston par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma with speech endowed with eight factors, because he teaches the Dharma with speech that is endowed with eight factors, with speech that is connected with the assembly, with speech that is connected with syllables, and so on, in an extensive way.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig ni grong khyer pa dang snyan zhing 'jebs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig ni grong khyer pa dang snyan zhing 'jebs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Speech endowed with eight factors is speech that is not corrupt, clear, pleasant, and so on.

original: gtam gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: gtam gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: He is skilled in the application of speech,

original: dus su dad gus pa la sogs pa rnam pa nyi shus gtam la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus su dad gus pa la sogs pa rnam pa nyi shus gtam la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he applies speech in twenty ways, at the proper time, with respect, and so on.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin te /üîΩthos pa @57a * //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin te / thos pa @57a * //
translated: He practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dang tshig lhur mi len cing ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang tshig lhur mi len cing ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not value listening to the Dharma or verbal recitation, but rather acts in accordance with what he has heard.

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with perfect conduct,

original: de gtam zer ba na lag pa sgul bar mi byed de /üîΩrkang pa sgul bar mi byed /
analyzed: de gtam zer ba na lag pa sgul bar mi byed de / rkang pa sgul bar mi byed /
translated: because when he speaks, he does not move his hands,üîΩdoes not move his feet,

original: smin ma skyod par mi byed /
analyzed: smin ma skyod par mi byed /
translated: does not move his eyebrows,

original: mgo sgyur bar mi byed /
analyzed: mgo sgyur bar mi byed /
translated: does not move his head,üîΩand does not look here and there.

original: bzhin sgyur bar mi byed lus sgyur bar mi byed ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhin sgyur bar mi byed lus sgyur bar mi byed ba yin no //
translated: He does not change his facial expression or his bodily posture.

original: mdzes pa yin te /
analyzed: mdzes pa yin te /
translated: He is attractive,

original: 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la mdzes pa yin no //
translated: because he is attractive in his coming and going, etc.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
translated: He is energetic,

original: de ma thos pa'i chos rnams ni nyan par byed /
analyzed: de ma thos pa'i chos rnams ni nyan par byed /
translated: because he listens to the Dharma that he has not heard,

original: thos pa'i chos rnams ni yongs su byang bar byed la /
analyzed: thos pa'i chos rnams ni yongs su byang bar byed la /
translated: and he purifies the Dharma that he has heard.

original: rnal 'byor mi gtong ba dang / yid la byed pa mi gtong ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas mi gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi gtong ba dang / yid la byed pa mi gtong ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas mi gtong ba yin no //
translated: He does not abandon his spiritual practice, his mental attention, or his inner tranquility.

original: ngal ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: ngal ba med pa yin te /
translated: He is indefatigable,

original: 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston pas yid yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston pas yid yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not mentally weary of teaching the Dharma to the four groups.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is patient,

original: de khros kyang phyir mi khro ba dang / mtshang brus kyang phyir mtshang 'bru bar mi byed pa dang / brgal tam phyir brgal tam khyad du gsad na yang nongs par mi 'gyur 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khros kyang phyir mi khro ba dang / mtshang brus kyang phyir mtshang 'bru bar mi byed pa dang / brgal tam phyir brgal tam khyad du gsad na yang nongs par mi 'gyur 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not get angry when others are angry, he does not retaliate when struck, and he does not get involved in disputes when others dispute with him.

original: de la bshad pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The explanation of this is eightfold:

original: brjid pa dang / rnam par 'grel ba dang ldan pa dang / rgol ba'i lan dang ldan pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ldan pa dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / de las gzhan pa las drangs pa dang / spobs pa las byung ba dang /üîΩgrub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: brjid pa dang / rnam par 'grel ba dang ldan pa dang / rgol ba'i lan dang ldan pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ldan pa dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / de las gzhan pa las drangs pa dang / spobs pa las byung ba dang / grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: 1. majestic, 2. endowed with interpretation, 3. endowed with replies to objections, 4. endowed with analysis, 5. related to that, 6. drawn from other sources, 7. arisen from eloquence, 8. following the conclusion.

original: de la 'khor ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The assembly is fivefold:

original: khyim na gnas pa'i 'khor dang / rab tu byung ba'i 'khor dang / dad pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor dang / zhe 'gras pa'i 'khor dang / tha mal par gnas pa'i 'khor to //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i 'khor dang / rab tu byung ba'i 'khor dang / dad pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor dang / zhe 'gras pa'i 'khor dang / tha mal par gnas pa'i 'khor to //
translated: the assembly of householders, the assembly of those gone forth, the assembly of the faithful, the assembly of the hostile, and the assembly of the indifferent.

original: de la brjid pa'i gtam ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjid pa'i gtam ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Majestic speech should be understood as fivefold:

original: gtan tshigs dang ldan pa dang / dpe dang ldan pa dang tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa dang / tshig dang / yig 'bru sna tshogs pa dang / go sla ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang ldan pa dang / dpe dang ldan pa dang tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa dang / tshig dang / yig 'bru sna tshogs pa dang / go sla ba'o //
translated: endowed with reasons, endowed with examples, endowed with verbal action, endowed with various words and syllables, and easy to understand.

original: de la rnam par 'grel pa dang ldan pa'i gtam ni zab mo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba yang zab mo dang ldan bar rnam par sgrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'grel pa dang ldan pa'i gtam ni zab mo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba yang zab mo dang ldan bar rnam par sgrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The discourse that is endowed with analysis is so called because it elucidates the profound and because it proclaims that which is clear and endowed with the profound.

original: de la rgol pa'i lan dang ldan pa'i gtam ni mdor bsdu na rgol ba rnam pa lnga spang pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgol pa'i lan dang ldan pa'i gtam ni mdor bsdu na rgol ba rnam pa lnga spang pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The discourse that is endowed with replies to objections is so called because it is endowed with the refutation of the five types of objections.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba dang ldan pa'i gtam ni chos re re la yang gcig las 'phros pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bcu'i bar lam de'i gong ma rab @57b tu dbye ba rnam par sgrog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba dang ldan pa'i gtam ni chos re re la yang gcig las 'phros pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bcu'i bar lam de'i gong ma rab @57b tu dbye ba rnam par sgrog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The discourse that is endowed with differentiation is so called because it proclaims the differentiation of the latter and former stages of the path, since each dharma is differentiated up to ten aspects by way of the method of the one arising from the one.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chos gsum las brtsams nas de skad gsungs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes rgya cher bya ba dag go //
analyzed: chos gsum las brtsams nas de skad gsungs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes rgya cher bya ba dag go //

translated: The discourse that is related to that is the one that is applied to the explanation of just those scriptures, such as the Sutras and the Verses of the Discourses, and not to the conclusion of others.

analyzed: de la spobs pa las byung ba'i gtam ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i don de ltar rnam par 'byed par byed pa'o //

translated: The discourse that follows from a philosophical position is the one that analyzes in dependence on a treatise or in dependence on a scripture that teaches a settled conclusion that is other than that.

original: de la khyim na gnas pa'i 'khor la ni nyes par spyad pa smad pa dang legs par spyad pa stong ba nye bar gnas pa'i chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la khyim na gnas pa'i 'khor la ni nyes par spyad pa smad pa dang legs par spyad pa stong ba nye bar gnas pa'i chos bstan par bya ste /

translated: For the assembly of the faithful and so on, a discourse on the greatness and power of the Dharma should be given in order to increase their faith and to establish them in the ordinary state.

translated: Likewise, they will accomplish the mundane and supramundane concentrations, liberations, meditative absorptions, and meditative attainments.
