analyzed: de yang bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, this is done in brief and in detail.

original: de la bsdus pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The brief praise should be understood in terms of five aspects:

original: gzugs bzang ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mkhyen pa dang / sgrub pa dang / mthus so //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mkhyen pa dang / sgrub pa dang / mthus so //
translated: excellent form, peace, knowledge, practice, and power.

original: de la gzugs bzang ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs bzang ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rig par bya ste /
translated: The excellent form is to be understood in terms of the thirty-two marks and the eighty signs of a great being.

original: de la nye bar zhi ba ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa nyid la sogs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar zhi ba ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa nyid la sogs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, peace is to be known from the restraint of the senses, etc., and from the destruction of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: de la mkhyen pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams dang dus kyis ma bsdus pa'i chos rnams la mkhyen pa thogs pa med cing chags pa med pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mkhyen pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams dang dus kyis ma bsdus pa'i chos rnams la mkhyen pa thogs pa med cing chags pa med pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, knowledge is to be known from the unobstructed and unattached knowledge of the past, future, and present times and of the dharmas not included in the times.

original: de la sgrub pa ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, accomplishment is to be known from the accomplishment of the fulfillment of benefit for oneself and others.

original: de la mthu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, power is to be known from the superknowledges of the Tathagata.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi bsngags ba bsdus te brjod pa ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi bsngags ba bsdus te brjod pa ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste /
translated: And that is to be known by way of the six aspects of the praise of the Blessed One.

original: yon tan rnams mtha' dag yin pa'i phyir dang / dri ma med pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba'i phyir dang / mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang sems can gyi don gyi phrin las can gyi phyir dang / las de la mthu mnga' ba'i phyir te /

translated: because they are the totality of virtues, because they are stainless, because they are unmoving, because they are incomparable, because they are the activity of benefit for self and others, and because they are the power of that activity.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi bsngags pa rgyas pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ni yon tan dpag tu med pa'i phyir bsngags pa mtha' yas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi bsngags pa rgyas pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ni yon tan dpag tu med pa'i phyir bsngags pa mtha' yas pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the extensive praise of the Blessed One is that he is praised infinitely because he is immeasurable in virtues.

original: de bzhin du ye shes kyi snang ba mdzad pa'i phyir snang ba stsol ba dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir mus pa sel ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes kyi snang ba mdzad pa'i phyir snang ba stsol ba dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir mus pa sel ba yang yin no //
translated: Similarly, he is the bestower of light because he illuminates with the light of wisdom, and he is the dispeller of darkness because he conquers the darkness of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du spyan gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir spyan dang ldan pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa mkhyen pa'i phyir don dam pa gzigs pa dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang tshul khrims 'byor ba'i phyir brtul zhugs grub pa yang yin no //

translated: Likewise, he is the one who has eyes because he has three eyes, the one who sees the ultimate because he knows the unequalled noble truths, and the one who has accomplished the practice because he is perfect in morality and has mastered morality.üîΩLikewise, he is the best of bipeds, the best of caravan leaders, the best of ascetics,

analyzed: gzhon pa dang / 'jig rten na rin po che dkon pa yang yin no //

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa /
translated: one who has gone to the supreme end of all the powers of the mind,

original: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su @61a * //üîΩzad pa yang yin no //

translated: and one who has exhausted all the fetters of existence.üîΩLikewise, he is one who has abandoned the five factors,üîΩone who possesses the six factors,üîΩone who is not mixed up in detail,üîΩone who is endowed with reliance,

original: de bzhin du yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / rgyas par ma 'dres pa dang / bsten pa dang ldan pa dang / skyes bu ltag na med pa zhes bya ba'i bar yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / rgyas par ma 'dres pa dang / bsten pa dang ldan pa dang / skyes bu ltag na med pa zhes bya ba'i bar yang yin no //

original: de bzhin du chos mkhyen pa dang / gang zag mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i bar yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mkhyen pa dang / gang zag mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i bar yang yin no //
translated: Likewise, he is the knower of phenomena, up to the knower of the supreme and nonsupreme.

original: de bzhin du dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / dri ma med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba dang / sman pa dang / ded dpon dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang 'gro ba'i mchog kyang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / dri ma med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba dang / sman pa dang / ded dpon dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang 'gro ba'i mchog kyang yin no //
translated: He is the ascetic, the brahmin, the stainless, the pure, the physician, the caravan leader, the seer, the protector of the world, and the supreme of men.

original: de la dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: dri ma dang bral ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang dri ma med pa ni kun nas dkris pa rtse bcil ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dri ma med pa ni kun nas dkris pa rtse bcil ba'i phyir ro //

original: dri ma dang bral ba ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par gzigs pa ni nyin mtshan lan drug 'jig rten la so sor gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa ni nyin mtshan lan drug 'jig rten la so sor gzigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par bsgrubs shing dus yun ring por yongs su 'dris par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi gzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par bsgrubs shing dus yun ring por yongs su 'dris par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi gzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: It is endowed with great compassion, because it is accomplished through three incalculable aeons, because it is cultivated for a long time, because it takes as its object all sentient beings, because it takes as its object all the aspects of suffering,

original: sems can thams cad kyis byas pa'i gnod pa rnam pa thams cad dang phrad pas phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis byas pa'i gnod pa rnam pa thams cad dang phrad pas phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: because it is irreversible in the face of all the harms that all sentient beings perpetrate, and because it engages all sentient beings in an attitude of sameness.

original: de la chos smra bas mdo sde rnam par bshad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la dang po kho nar tshig 'bru dang don yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos smra bas mdo sde rnam par bshad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la dang po kho nar tshig 'bru dang don yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: The Dharma teacher who has thus established the characteristics of the Dharma to be explained should first investigate the words and their meanings.

original: de'i 'og tu ji skad bstan pa'i bya bas chos @61b ston pa na gzhan dag la rnam par bshad pa rnam pa lngas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji skad bstan pa'i bya bas chos @61b ston pa na gzhan dag la rnam par bshad pa rnam pa lngas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, when teaching the Dharma by means of the previously mentioned activities, one should engage others in the five kinds of explanations.

original: de ltar gyur nas bdag nyid chos smra ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa ji skad bstan pa dag la chos dang don la mkhas pa la sogs pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur nas bdag nyid chos smra ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa ji skad bstan pa dag la chos dang don la mkhas pa la sogs pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having become such, one should be established in the ten characteristics of a Dharma teacher, as previously described, by means of skill in the Dharma, skill in the meaning, and so forth.

original: de ltar bdag nyid rnam par bzhag nas 'khor rnam pa lnga po dag la snga ma kho na bzhin du brjid pa'i gtam la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad po dag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i gtam bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid rnam par bzhag nas 'khor rnam pa lnga po dag la snga ma kho na bzhin du brjid pa'i gtam la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad po dag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i gtam bya'o //
translated: Having thus established oneself, one should engage in conversation with the five kinds of assemblies, as before, by means of the eight topics such as majestic speech.

original: gtam de dag zer ba na gzhan dag rna gtod pa la sbyar bar bya zhing dang por ston pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gtam de dag zer ba na gzhan dag rna gtod pa la sbyar bar bya zhing dang por ston pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: When engaging in those conversations, one should cause others to pay attention, and first one should speak in praise of the Teacher.

original: de ltar yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sil snyan dang 'dra bar bdag dang / gzhan dag la dga' ba rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sil snyan dang 'dra bar bdag dang / gzhan dag la dga' ba rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the Dharma endowed with five limbs generates great joy in oneself and others, like a musical instrument endowed with five qualities.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag la phan pa'i phyir 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag la phan pa'i phyir 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also applied for the benefit of oneself and others.

original: de ltar mkhas par 'gyur ba la ni phan yon rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: de ltar mkhas par 'gyur ba la ni phan yon rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five benefits to becoming learned in this way:

original: tshegs chung ngus sangs rgyas kyi bka'i don rtogs par 'gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i gtam dag la 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dge ba dang nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur pa dang ;
analyzed: tshegs chung ngus sangs rgyas kyi bka'i don rtogs par 'gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i gtam dag la 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dge ba dang nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa rgya chen po skyed par 'gyur pa dang ;
translated: One will understand the meaning of the Buddha‚Äôs words with little difficulty, one will engage in discourses that are complete in all aspects, one will generate great joy and supreme joy that is virtuous and conducive to liberation in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mindstreams,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi bar dag las snyan par dang grags pa dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan par rgyas par 'gyur pa dang / bsod nams tshang med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi bar dag las snyan par dang grags pa dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan par rgyas par 'gyur pa dang / bsod nams tshang med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and among gods and humans, his fame, his good reputation, his praise, and his acclaim will spread.

original: dge slong dag bslab pa la phan yon du gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs pa ni mdo'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag bslab pa la phan yon du gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs pa ni mdo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, you should abide in the benefits of the training.‚Äù

original: de'i lus ni tshig 'bru dang don to //
analyzed: de'i lus ni tshig 'bru dang don to //
translated: His body is the letters and the meaning.

original: de la dge slong dag bslab pa la phan yon du gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs pa ni ye ge bcu gnyis dang / ming bzhi dang / tshig gcig yin te /
analyzed: de la dge slong dag bslab pa la phan yon du gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs pa ni ye ge bcu gnyis dang / ming bzhi dang / tshig gcig yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, you should abide in the benefits of the training‚Äù is twelve letters, four words, and one sentence.

original: de dag ni re zhig ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs yin no //
translated: These are the collections of names, words, and letters.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa yin no ;
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa yin no ;
translated: The teaching of the bases of the training is the aspect.

original: / dge slong rnams la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / dge slong rnams la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the TathƒÅgata that is based on the monks is the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bka' gang yin pa de ni ngag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bka' gang yin pa de ni ngag yin no //
translated: That which is the word of the Tathagata is speech.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag ni tshig 'bru yin te /üîΩshes rab dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la yang de @62a * //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag ni tshig 'bru yin te / shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la yang de @62a * //
translated: These six aspects are the letter.

original: bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood in the case of the words: 'highest wisdom', etc.

original: don ni nyan thos kyis bstan pa 'di'am sa lnga po thams cad de /
analyzed: don ni nyan thos kyis bstan pa 'di'am sa lnga po thams cad de /
translated: The meaning is the teaching of the Sravakas or all five stages.

original: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi sa'o //
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi sa'o //
translated: The 'benefit of training in it' refers to the stage of equipment.

original: shes rab dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i sa'o //
translated: 'Highest wisdom' refers to the stage of added effort.

original: rnam par grol ba'i snying po dang dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i sa dang bsgom pa'i sa dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i snying po dang dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i sa dang bsgom pa'i sa dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i don yin no //
translated: 'Essence of liberation and the power of mindfulness' refers to the stage of vision, the stage of meditative development and the stage that leads to the final goal.

original: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The 'benefit of training in it' refers to the own-characteristic of morality.

original: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: 'Highest wisdom' refers to the own-characteristic of wisdom.

original: de'i rten dang grogs la sogs pa lus tsam ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rten dang grogs la sogs pa lus tsam ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The body, as the basis and support, etc. , is the individual characteristic.

original: shes rab dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom with a mental object is the universal characteristic.

original: nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i snying por rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i snying por rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Freedom from the addictions and the residues is the individual characteristic of the core of liberation.

original: dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The power of mindfulness is the individual characteristic of mindfulness.

original: de ltar de ni mtshan nyid kyi don yin no //üîΩde la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa 'ga' yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de ni mtshan nyid kyi don yin no // de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa 'ga' yang ma yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of characteristic.

original: de ni yid la byed pa'i rten yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ni yid la byed pa'i rten yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The benefits of the training are not any of the attentions, but they are taught as the basis of the attentions.

original: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang mos pa yid la byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang mos pa yid la byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The highest wisdom is the attention of discernment and of aspiration.

original: rnam par grol ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The essence of liberation is taught as being seclusion, the gathering of joy, the culmination of application, and the result of the culmination of application.

original: dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa yin te de ltar de ni yid la byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa yin te de ltar de ni yid la byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the attention of investigation. Thus, this is the meaning of attention.

original: tshul des shes pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul des shes pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this method to knowledge, etc.

original: dbang du bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa'i gzhis bsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa'i gzhis bsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa yin no //
translated: One should understand that the practice of purification is the basis of training, which is governed by nirvana.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par byang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa nas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i bar dang dge ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa dag kyang 'di la yod mod kyi gtso cher rnam
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par byang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa nas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i bar dang dge ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa dag kyang 'di la yod mod kyi gtso cher rnam
translated: Although the practice of virtue, etc., exists in this, such as the correct engagement of taking up, etc., up to the correct rejoicing, the practice of purification is foremost.

original: par byang ba'i spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: par byang ba'i spyod pa yin no //
translated: This is the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: gang zag gi dbang du bya ba ni gang zag khyim med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi dbang du bya ba ni gang zag khyim med pa'o //
translated: The person is the one who is not a householder.

original: dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag thams cad ni yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //üîΩ'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus su yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs @62b pa rnams la ni da ltar gyi dus su yang dag par bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag thams cad ni yang dag par dga' bar bya'o // 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus su yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs @62b pa rnams la ni da ltar gyi dus su yang dag par bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
translated: All persons, such as those of dull faculties, are to be gladdened.üîΩThose who have taken up morality are to be instructed in the present, and are to be caused to take it up in the future.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ste /
translated: They are to be gladdened, and they are to be praised.

original: de ltar de ni dbang du bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de ni dbang du bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the person.

original: de la phan yon ni bslab pa gsum po dag gis bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan yon ni bslab pa gsum po dag gis bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The benefit is the completion of the cultivation of the three trainings.

original: nyes dmigs ni de ltar ma byas na mi 'gyur ba dang rab tu byung pa don dang ldan pa mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni de ltar ma byas na mi 'gyur ba dang rab tu byung pa don dang ldan pa mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The disadvantage is that if one does not act in this way, one will not become a true renunciate.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni tshul khrims 'chal ba dang mi shes pa dang brjed ngas pa dang nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni tshul khrims 'chal ba dang mi shes pa dang brjed ngas pa dang nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: The adverse factors are immorality, ignorance, forgetfulness, and the afflictions.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni tshul khrims la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni tshul khrims la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Their antidotes are morality, etc.

original: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa thams cad do //
translated: Moreover, the adverse factors are all the activities of affliction.

original: gnyen po ni bslab pa gsum po dag go //
analyzed: gnyen po ni bslab pa gsum po dag go //
translated: The antidotes are the three educations.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni bslab pa'i phan yon la gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba nas dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni bslab pa'i phan yon la gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba nas dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba'i bar dag ste /
translated: The summarized meaning is: ‚ÄúYou should abide in the benefits of the educations‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe power of mindfulness.‚Äù

original: de ni mdor bstan pa las bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdor bstan pa las bsdus pa yin no //

original: rgyas pa ni de rnam par 'byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni de rnam par 'byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar de ni bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i don yin te de las gong na yang med pa de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: Thus, this is the summarized and extensive meaning, and there is nothing higher than this, nothing more than this.

original: de la rnam par bshad pa'i chos ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag las re zhig de ni mdo'i sdes bsdus pa dang lung du bstan pa'i sde yin par blta bar bya ste nges pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par bshad pa'i chos ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag las re zhig de ni mdo'i sdes bsdus pa dang lung du bstan pa'i sde yin par blta bar bya ste nges pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the sutra collection, which is the definitive meaning because it is the collection of the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: kun nas slong ba ni dbang du bya ba las brjod par bya ste /üîΩbdag nyid thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i stobs ston par 'dod pas mdo sde rtsom par byed pa dang / yang gdul ba rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa la brtson pa zang zing la gdu zhing de la mos pa rnams bslabs pa'i phan yon la sogs pa la gnas pa la bslab pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phan yon yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni dbang du bya ba las brjod par bya ste / bdag nyid thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i stobs ston par 'dod pas mdo sde rtsom par byed pa dang / yang gdul ba rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa la brtson pa zang zing la gdu zhing de la mos pa rnams bslabs pa'i phan yon la sogs pa la gnas pa la bslab pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phan yon yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i
translated: The motivation should be expressed in terms of the object.üîΩThe Buddha composes the sutras in order to demonstrate the power of knowing the path that leads everywhere, and in order to teach the benefits of the training to those who are devoted to the conduct of complete purification of the disciples, who are devoted to material things and are interested in them.

original: phyir dang / yang dge slong gi dngos po bzhi yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyir dang / yang dge slong gi dngos po bzhi yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: He also composes the sutras in order to teach the benefits of completing the three trainings for those who abide in the benefits of the training and so on, and in order to teach the four qualities of a fully ordained monk.

original: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge slong nyid dang / cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge slong nyid las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge slong nyid dang / cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge slong nyid las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: The benefits of training are the reversal of the monk's pride in his color, marks, and shape, and in his observance of rituals and hypocrisy.

original: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i dge slong nyid la 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dam pa zhes bya ba ni grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i dge slong nyid la 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: The highest wisdom is the reversal of the monk's pride in his fame, reputation, and praise.

original: rnam par grol ba'i snying po dang dran pa'i dbang zhes bya @63a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i snying po dang dran pa'i dbang zhes bya @63a * //
translated: The essence of liberation and mastery of mindfulness

original: ba des ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge slong nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ba des ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge slong nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /

original: 'di ltar grags pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ni so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar grags pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ni so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: Thus, one who desires fame, etc. should memorize the scriptures after careful consideration.

original: shes rab 'phel bar mi byed pa dang / nyes pa sngar ma spangs pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pas bsdus pa'i rnam par grol ba yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab 'phel bar mi byed pa dang / nyes pa sngar ma spangs pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pas bsdus pa'i rnam par grol ba yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and does not increase wisdom, and does not previously abandon faults, then he is one who is correctly engaged in right practice, because he is one who correctly takes up liberation.

original: yang dman pas chog par 'dzin pa la zhugs pa rnams gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dman pas chog par 'dzin pa la zhugs pa rnams gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, for those who are engaged in being satisfied with what is inferior, he is one who correctly takes up what is superior to that.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig yongs su tshol zhing lhod pa rnams la ni bslab pa'i phan yon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig yongs su tshol zhing lhod pa rnams la ni bslab pa'i phan yon zhes gsungs so //
translated: For those who are lax in their pursuit of the secret spells of the LokƒÅyatas, he is one who teaches the benefits of training.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa thos pa la mi ltos pa rnams la ni shes rab dam pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa thos pa la mi ltos pa rnams la ni shes rab dam pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: For those who are morally disciplined but do not rely on learning, he is one who teaches the highest wisdom.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnams la ni rnam par grol ba'i snying po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnams la ni rnam par grol ba'i snying po zhes gsungs so //
translated: For those who are satisfied with mere learning and reflection, he is one who teaches the essence of liberation.

original: tshul khrims dang shes rab dang rnam par grol bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa rnams la ni dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang shes rab dang rnam par grol bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa rnams la ni dran pa'i dbang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For those who are conceited about morality, wisdom, and liberation, he taught the one called the power of mindfulness.

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de lta bu dag gis kun nas slong ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the instigation should be stated in such a way.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'dir yang dag pa'i sgrub pa dang 'bras bu yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'dir yang dag pa'i sgrub pa dang 'bras bu yin par bstan te /
translated: Here, the summarized meaning is taught as right practice and result.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum po de tsam gyis ni bslab pa'i mthar thug pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar gnas par gyis zhes gsungs pas ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa yongs su bstan to //

analyzed: de ltar gnas pa rnams kyi bslab pa gsum zhes gsungs pas ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bstan to //
translated: By saying the three trainings of those who abide thus, the result of right practice is taught.

original: de la dad pa dang 'dun pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par blang pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dad pa dang 'dun pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par blang pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //

original: thos pa 'dzin pa'i dus na ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa'i dus na ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: At the time of retaining what is heard, it is effort.

original: shes rab la sogs pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa ni thabs yin no //

original: de la tshig gi don ni bslab pa dang / rjes su brtson pa dang / ji ltar gdams pa bzhin sgrub pa dang / goms pa dang / sgom pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de la tshig gi don ni bslab pa dang / rjes su brtson pa dang / ji ltar gdams pa bzhin sgrub pa dang / goms pa dang / sgom pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: In this regard, the terms ‚Äútraining,‚Äù ‚Äústriving,‚Äù ‚Äúaccomplishing in accordance with the instructions,‚Äù ‚Äúhabitual practice,‚Äù and ‚Äúcultivation‚Äù are synonyms.

original: sgrub pa de ni lus dang ngag dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag par kun tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims kyis rab tu phye ba dang bzod pas rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir bslab bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa de ni lus dang ngag dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag par kun tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims kyis rab tu phye ba dang bzod pas rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir bslab bzhes bya'o //
translated: That accomplishment is distinguished by morality, which is characterized by the union of pure bodily and vocal conduct and livelihood, and by patience. Therefore, it is called ‚Äútraining.‚Äù

original: yang zhi ba'i phyir 'gro bas bslab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang zhi ba'i phyir 'gro bas bslab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is called ‚Äútraining‚Äù because it proceeds to peace.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag @63b ni nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag @63b ni nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Such are the etymologies in this context.

original: rtags dang ngo bo nyid dang las dang chos dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtags dang ngo bo nyid dang las dang chos dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The signs, nature, activity, attributes, causes, and results should be explained as before.

original: de la re zhig ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas bslab pa'i phan yon ni tshul khrims rnam pa bdun dang bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas bslab pa'i phan yon ni tshul khrims rnam pa bdun dang bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the benefits of training are first distinguished by nature, as the seven types of morality and the two hundred and fifty rules of training are taught.

original: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang mi ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang mi ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Therein, the distinction of realms is the vow of individual liberation that pertains to the desire realm, the vow of meditation that pertains to the form realm, and the uncontaminated vow that pertains to the formless realm.

original: dus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'das pa'i dus su yang bslab pa'i phan yon 'di lta bu kho nar gyur la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'di lta bu kho nar 'gyur pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang bslab pa'i phan yon 'di lta bu kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'das pa'i dus su yang bslab pa'i phan yon 'di lta bu kho nar gyur la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'di lta bu kho nar 'gyur pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang bslab pa'i phan yon 'di lta bu kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the division of time, it should be understood that in the past, the benefits of training were just as they are now; in the future, the benefits of training will be just as they are now; and in the present, the benefits of training are just as they are now.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye bas ni gang zag zhugs pa yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi bslab pa'i phan yon ni chung du'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye bas ni gang zag zhugs pa yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi bslab pa'i phan yon ni chung du'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: By the division of circumstances, the benefits of training for individuals who have entered the path but are not fully matured are of a lesser kind.

original: yongs su smin pa rnams kyi ni 'bring gi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams kyi ni 'bring gi gnas skabs yin no //

analyzed: yongs su smin par gyur pa rnams kyi ni chen po'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: For those who have become fully matured, they are of a great kind.

original: so sor brtags nas mngon par mi dga' bzhin du tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa rnams kyi bslab pa'i phan yon ni sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs yin no //

analyzed: mngon par dga' ba rnams kyi ni bde ba'i gnas skabs yin no //

translated: The benefits of training are a state that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant for those who are neither pleased nor displeased.

original: bslab pa'i phan yon de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i gnas skabs yin gyi /
analyzed: bslab pa'i phan yon de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i gnas skabs yin gyi /
translated: All of these benefits of training are states of virtue.

analyzed: mi dge ba'i gnas skabs kyang ma yin no //

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not indeterminate states.

original: thos pa gzung ba rnams kyi ni thos pa'i gnas skabs yin no //üîΩbsams pa rnams kyi ni bsams pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: thos pa gzung ba rnams kyi ni thos pa'i gnas skabs yin no // bsams pa rnams kyi ni bsams pa'i gnas skabs yin no //

original: bsgoms pa rnams kyi yang bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa rnams kyi yang bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: They are a state of meditation for those who are meditating.

analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab ma thog pa rnams kyi ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas skabs kho na yin no //
translated: They are a state of superior morality for those who have not attained superior mind and superior wisdom.

original: de dag thob pa rnams kyi ni de dag gi gnas skabs kyang yin te /
analyzed: de dag thob pa rnams kyi ni de dag gi gnas skabs kyang yin te /
translated: Those who have attained them are also in their states.

analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no // de la gang zag gi @64a * //
translated: Such are the distinctions of states.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni 'dir gang zag rab tu byung ba yin par dgongs so //üîΩde yang dbang po rtul po yang yod /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni 'dir gang zag rab tu byung ba yin par dgongs so // de yang dbang po rtul po yang yod /

analyzed: dbang po rnon po yang yod do // 'dod chags la sogs pa spyad pa yang yod /

original: cha mnyam par spyad pa yang yod do //
analyzed: cha mnyam par spyad pa yang yod do //

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba yang yod do //

original: nyan thos kho na'i yin gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi yang ma yin /
analyzed: nyan thos kho na'i yin gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi yang ma yin /
translated: This is only for the ≈õrƒÅvaka, not for the pratyekabuddha,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: and not for the bodhisattva.

translated: Because the pratyekabuddha is enlightened by himself, and the bodhisattva is not taught to abide in this essence of liberation.

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can kho na'i yin te /

analyzed: 'ching ba med pa'i ni ma yin no //

original: mir gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mir gyur pa yin gyi /

analyzed: lhar gyur pa'i ni ma yin te /

translated: Just as with the benefits of training, so too should the fivefold classification be understood in the case of the essence of supreme wisdom and the essence of liberation, and in the case of the power of mindfulness, as is appropriate.

analyzed: de la phan yon dang / yon tan dang / mtho ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Here, benefits, qualities, excellence, and perfection are synonyms.

translated: Having seen the ten benefits, he saw that this Dharma is beneficial for the body and worthy of praise, so it is a benefit.

analyzed: yang mthun par skyes pa'i sems can rnams 'di'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur bas phan yon no //

analyzed: yang legs su smon par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir yang phan yon no //

analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa bcur dbye bas rig par bya ste /
translated: The analysis should be understood as a tenfold division,

analyzed: dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa yangs par gyur pa lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir

translated: He is compassionate because he has long dwelt in the immeasurables of love and so on for sentient beings.üîΩHe

analyzed: thugs rje bar mdzad pa ni zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma sel bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The compassionate one is the one who acts in the middle, because he removes the many kinds of evil and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de la tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang rus rnams kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang rus rnams kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Brahmacarya that is beneficial to many people is for the sake of the castes and families of the Ksatriyas, etc.

original: yangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs de dag nyid gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba las brtsams nas so //
analyzed: yangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs de dag nyid gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba las brtsams nas so //
translated: It is extensive because it is based on the increase of those very kinds of sentient beings.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la mthu yod pa'i phyir yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la mthu yod pa'i phyir yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is for the sake of gods and humans because they have the power for that, but not because the compassion of the Lord is limited.

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis so //üîΩde la chos ston zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan @68a * //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis so // de la chos ston zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan @68a * //
translated: It is the perfect teaching because it is the way things are and the extent of the way things are.

original: lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: bzung zhing kun chub par byas nas bcang bar bya /
analyzed: bzung zhing kun chub par byas nas bcang bar bya /
translated: Having taken it up and mastered it, one should keep it.

original: man ngag tu bya zhes bya ba ni tshig dang dben par song nas so //
analyzed: man ngag tu bya zhes bya ba ni tshig dang dben par song nas so //
translated: One should make it one's instruction means: having gone to a place free from noise.

original: nges par brtag par bya zhes bya ba ni chos so //
analyzed: nges par brtag par bya zhes bya ba ni chos so //
translated: One should investigate it means: the Dharma.

original: 'di ni khyed la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni khyed la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: This is for your benefit means: that which is done with reference to the superior morality.

original: /'di ni bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang mi dga' ba rang la rag lus pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: /'di ni bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang mi dga' ba rang la rag lus pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is for your happiness means: the practice of grief and sorrow that is dependent on oneself.

original: 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: This is for your benefit and happiness means: the practice of superior mind and superior wisdom of those who are free from passion.

original: de yang dge ba'i phyir ni phan pa yin la phan 'dogs phyir ni bde ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i phyir ni phan pa yin la phan 'dogs phyir ni bde ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is beneficial because it is virtuous, and it is happiness because it is helpful.

original: yang 'di ni phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'di ni phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams bsngags pa'o //
translated: This is for your benefit means: that which is praised by the Blessed One in the qualities of austerity.

original: 'di ni bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zas dang gos 'bum ri ba rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zas dang gos 'bum ri ba rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is for the sake of happiness, where the Buddha permitted food with a hundred flavors and clothing worth a hundred thousand.

original: 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang la bslab pa gsum bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang la bslab pa gsum bcas pa'o //
translated: This is for the sake of benefit and happiness, where the three trainings are established.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dang der chos de dag shes rab kyis legs par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i phyir gang dag yin pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dang der chos de dag shes rab kyis legs par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i phyir gang dag yin pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata has thoroughly understood those dharmas with wisdom in such and such a way means that he has thoroughly understood with wisdom those that are for the sake of benefit and happiness, and also those that are for the sake of the higher virtue, higher mind, and higher wisdom.

original: des rgyu gnyis kyis na legs par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des rgyu gnyis kyis na legs par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: He has thoroughly understood them with two causes:

original: yun ring po nas goms pa dang phyin ci ma log par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: yun ring po nas goms pa dang phyin ci ma log par rtogs pas so //
translated: through long-term cultivation and through non-erroneous understanding.

original: de dang der rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par reg ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab las brtsams nas so //
analyzed: de dang der rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par reg ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab las brtsams nas so //
translated: The phrase he touches with his body the reality that is to be realized means that he touches it well through liberation in that and that situation, i.e., beginning with the higher thought of enlightenment and the higher wisdom.

original: de la rgyu gnyis kyis ni shin tu legs par reg pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu gnyis kyis ni shin tu legs par reg pa yin te /
translated: He touches it well for two reasons:

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i chos nyid kyis yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su ma rdzogs zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims de nyid la phyogs gcig byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i chos nyid kyis yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su ma rdzogs zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims de nyid la phyogs gcig byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because he goes to the ultimate goal and because he does not fall away from the nature of non-returning.

original: des tshul khrims la brten nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i tshul khrims dag yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa'o //üîΩbdag gis chos 'di dag shin tu legs par ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: des tshul khrims la brten nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i tshul khrims dag yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa'o //üîΩbdag gis chos 'di dag shin tu legs par ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase he does not consider his aggregate of morality to be perfect means that he does not consider it perfect because he has only partially fulfilled it, or because he has not fulfilled the morality of the stage of meditative concentration, which is based on morality.üîΩThe phrase he does not consider his aggregate of wisdom to be perfect means that he does not consider it perfect because he has only partially fulfilled it, or because he has not fulfilled the wisdom of the stage of meditative concentration, which is based on wisdom.

original: shin tu legs par ma reg ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis @68b kyis te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu legs par ma reg ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis @68b kyis te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot touching too much‚Äù is in two ways, as before.

original: de ltar na ngas smras pa gang yin pa de so sor bshad pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ni de ltar mdor bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ngas smras pa gang yin pa de so sor bshad pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ni de ltar mdor bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the summary of the analysis of the brief introduction should be understood as follows: ‚ÄúWhatever I have said is explained individually.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang mdo sde rnam par bshad pa ni rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde rnam par bshad pa ni rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the explanation of the sutra should be applied in six ways:

original: dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / nyes par spyad pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / legs par spyad pa yang dag par blang ba dang / nad la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis shes pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / nyes par spyad pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / legs par spyad pa yang dag par blang ba dang / nad la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis shes pa dang /
translated: understanding things, abandoning bad conduct, afflictions, and secondary afflictions, taking up good conduct, understanding through the aspects of illness, etc.,

original: yongs su shes pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / bdag nyid dang / gzhan dag gis de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / bdag nyid dang / gzhan dag gis de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ste /
translated: understanding complete understanding, the result of that, oneself, and the realization of the result by others.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag dang / sngar ji ltar rnam pa gzhag pa dag gis mdo sde rnam par bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag dang / sngar ji ltar rnam pa gzhag pa dag gis mdo sde rnam par bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the sutras should be applied by way of these aspects and by way of the previously explained aspects.

original: de la dngos po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the thing is as follows:

original: phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang ; / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang ; / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
translated: the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, the establishments of mindfulness, the right efforts, and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Its result is as follows:

original: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol ba'o //
translated: disenchantment, freedom from attachment, liberation, and complete liberation.

original: de la bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gis de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ni bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gis de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ni bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of its result by oneself and others is as follows: ‚ÄúMy births are exhausted,‚Äù and so on. This is called the summary of the explanation.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba rdzogs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba rdzogs te /
translated: The summary of the explanation from the Bodhisattva Levels is complete.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa thams cad rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa thams cad rdzogs so /
translated: The entire Bodhisattvabhumi is now complete.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa 'di ni 'phags pa thogs med bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu byon pa chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin byang bar brnyes pa 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhabs kyi pad ma rnyog pa med pa'i ze'u'iüîΩ'bru spyi bos len par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa 'di ni 'phags pa thogs med bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu byon pa chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin byang bar brnyes pa 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhabs kyi pad ma rnyog pa med pa'i ze'u'i 'bru spyi bos len par mdzad pa ste /
translated: This Bodhisattvabhumi was composed by the Arya Asanga, who has gone beyond the ocean of the tenets of our own and other schools, who has attained the perfection of the samadhi of the stream of Dharma, who has placed upon his head the pollen-dust of the stainless lotus feet of the Arya Ajita.

original: rnal 'byor pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir go cha chen po bgos pa rnams kyis dang du blang bar bya'o /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir go cha chen po bgos pa rnams kyis dang du blang bar bya'o /
translated: It should be taken up by the yogis who have donned the great armor for the sake of the unsurpassed enlightenment which accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a wa rma dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan pa phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a wa rma dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan pa phab pa /
translated: It was translated, corrected and finalized by the Indian abbot Prajnavardha, the abbot Surendrabodhi, and the great editor and translator Bandhe Yeshe De.

original: 'di la shlo ka lnga brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga yod do / spyir sha lo ka bzhi khri lnga stong yod do //
analyzed: 'di la shlo ka lnga brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga yod do / spyir sha lo ka bzhi khri lnga stong yod do //
translated: It has 575 ≈õlokas.üîΩIn general, there are 45,000 ≈õlokas.
